thread.title: Salgado leads UNG men's soccer to shutout win over Shorter
thread.title_full: Salgado leads UNG men's soccer to shutout win over Shorter

author: AccessWDUN staff
title: Salgado leads UNG men's soccer to shutout win over Shorter
text:
By AccessWDUN staff Related Articles Lee holds off West Georgia, UNG 4th at LeeAnn Noble tourney No. 2 UNG women's soccer battles to scoreless draw vs. Armstrong Lenoir-Rhyne scores golden goal to knock off N. Georgia men No. 11 Lady Nighthawks sweep road trip with win over Lees-McRae 
DAHLONEGA — Irving Salgado knocked home a goal in the 78th minute and the Nighthawk defense would preserve the shutout as the University of North Georgia men's soccer team defeated Shorter, 1-0, on Tuesday evening at the UNG Soccer Complex. 
The Nighthawks are unbeaten in their last four matches and improve to 4-8-2 overall on the season. Shorter falls to 5-8-1. 
After a scoreless first half in which both teams collected six shots apiece, the UNG offense would press on all cylinders, outshooting the Hawks 16-3 after intermission. 
Carl Ludwig Eriksson assisted Salgado's goal off of a corner kick. 
NOTES -- North Georgia is unbeaten in its last four contests (3-0-1). 
-- The goal was Salgado's first career tally. 
-- North Georgia improves to 3-2-1 in home matches at the UNG Soccer Complex. 
-- Victor Ohlin collected five saves as the senior goalie improved to 4-3-1 in between the pipes for UNG. It was his second shutout in the team's last three matches. 
STAT OF THE DAY 16-3 - North Georgia outshot Shorter 16-3 in the final 45 minutes. 
NEXT UP The Nighthawks will step back into Peach Belt Conference play on Saturday (Oct. 24) with a home match against Flagler. Kick off is scheduled for 3:30 p.m. Associated Tags : North Georgia sports © Copyright 2015 AccessWDUN.com No. 2 Lady Bulldogs finish 5th at Stanford The No. 2-ranked Georgia women's golf team wrapped up its most successful fall in a decade with a fifth-place finish at the Stanford Intercollegiate on Monday. Playing with only four golfers, the Bulldogs shot 8-over 292 and finished the 54-hole event at 870. 9:44PM ( 9 hours ago ) Brian Gregory, under a mandate to show progress in his fifth season as Georgia Tech's coach, is relying on veteran transfers to make the Yellow Jackets relevant again in the ACC. 9:35PM ( 9 hours ago ) Lee holds off West Georgia, UNG 4th at LeeAnn Noble tourney The Flames of Lee University held off a charge from West Georgia to claim the 2nd Annual LeeAnn Noble Memorial Golf Tournament team title by a single stroke on Tuesday afternoon on the par 72, 5,887 yard Achasta Golf Course. Lee's Caroline Moore earned individual medalist honors with a one-under 72-71-143. 8:26PM ( 10 hours ago )
